de.ase34.flyingblocksapi

Class FlyingBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ase34.flyingblocksapi.FlyingBlock
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlagCommandExecutor.FlagFlyingBlock

    public abstract class FlyingBlock
extends Object
    Handles the entities required for making a flying block.

      • FlyingBlock

        public FlyingBlock(org.bukkit.Material material,
           byte materialData,
           int trackerUpdateInterval,
           double heightOffset,
           int horseAge)
        Constructs a new FlyingBlock.
        Parameters:
        material - The material
        materialData - The material's data
        trackerUpdateInterval - The update interval of the tracker (in ticks)
        heightOffset - The height offset of the skull
        horseAge - The age of the horse
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the singleton of NativesAPI was not set yet.

    • Method Detail

      • spawn

        public void spawn(org.bukkit.Location location)
        Creates and spawns this FlyingBlock at the specified position. The height offset will be automatically applied so that the center of the falling block appears at the given position. If spawn(Location) was already called, this methods first invokes remove().
        Parameters:
        location - The location to spawn the entity at

      • onTick

        public abstract void onTick()
        This method gets called every tick and can be used to modify location and motion of this FlyingBlock. Please note these special cases:
        • In order to change the motion/velocity/direction, please use setVelocity(org.bukkit.util.Vector).
        • In order to change the location, please use setLocation(Location).

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Removes all involved entities so that this FlyingBlock gets removed.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(org.bukkit.Location location)

        Sets the location of this FlyingBlock to the specified location. Please keep in mind that this sets the location of the wither skull, not the block itself. The block is located below the skull. (See getHeightOffset()) If the world of the speicified location does not match that of the entity, remove() is invoked followed by spawn(Location) with the specified location. In onTick(), this method needs to be used instead of getBukkitEntity().teleport(Location) as the latter one is broken for entities with passengers.

        If the horse's age and the height offset is the default one, setBlockLocation(Location) might be a good utility.

        Parameters:
        location - The location to move the entity to
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if the entity is dead
        See Also:
        setBlockLocation(Location), getHeightOffset()

      • setBlockLocation

        public void setBlockLocation(org.bukkit.Location location)
        Convenience method to make the block's center appear at the specified position. This calls setLocation(Location) with the height offset (getHeightOffset()) added to the y-coordinate location. If the height offset or the age is different to the default values, this method might not give proper results.
        Parameters:
        location -
        See Also:
        setLocation(Location), getHeightOffset(), getHorseAge()

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(org.bukkit.util.Vector velocity)
        Sets the velocity of this FlyingBlock. Convenience method analogous to setLocation(Location).
        Parameters:
        velocity - The

      • getBukkitEntity

        public org.bukkit.entity.WitherSkull getBukkitEntity()
        Gets the underlying entity as Bukkit entity. May be null if not spawned yet by spawn(Location).
        Returns:
        The Bukkit entity

      • getTrackerUpdateInterval

        public int getTrackerUpdateInterval()

      • getHeightOffset

        public double getHeightOffset()
        Gets the height offset of the skull. The y-coordinate of the flying block's center appears at the y-coordinate of the skull minus the return value of getHeightOffset().
        Returns:
        The height offset

      • getHorseAge

        public int getHorseAge()
